name: American History 1940s Quiz | U.S. History | 10 Questions

questions.text: William Levitt made his fame and fortune in what industry?
questions.explanation:
Housing.

	He had the answer to post war housing. Founded Levittown, N.Y.

questions.text: Who was the Commander of the U.S. Naval forces in the Pacific in World War 2?
questions.explanation:
Chester Nimitz.

	He was the Commander of all land and sea forces in the Pacific area.

questions.text: Where did the D-Day landings take place?
questions.explanation:
Normandy.

	Also called 'Operation Overlord'. June 6, 1944. Five beaches were involved - Utah, Omaha, Gold, Juno and Sword.

questions.text: What aircraft was the first to use pressurization on a commercial flight?
questions.explanation:
Boeing.

	One of the many improvements to flying since the Wright Brothers.

questions.text: Which movie featured the song 'White Christmas' in 1954?
questions.explanation:
'White Christmas'.

	A 1954 movie starring Bing Crosby, Danny Kaye, Rosemary Clooney and Vera Ellen.

questions.text: Jackie Robinson of the Brooklyn Dodgers played what position mostly?
questions.explanation:
2nd Base.

	He was the first black ballplayer in the major leagues. He played there from 1947-1956. Later in his career, he played the outfield.

questions.text: What publishing house was founded by William Randolf Hearst?
questions.explanation:
Avon.

	Famous in that field. Lived from 1863-1951. Started the rise of 'Yellow Journalism'.

questions.text: Herman Goering's cause of death was what?
questions.explanation:
Suicide.

	He was condemmed to hang in 1946 after The Nuremberg Trials, but he took poison and died the night his execution was ordered.

questions.text: Which of the following did France proclaim a Republic in 1930?
questions.explanation:
Syria.

	It was recognized as an independent Republic but still subject to mandate.
